t: Amazon announces its largest reduction in plastic packaging in North America to date
s: June 20, 2024 - Amazon has replaced 95% of the plastic air pillows from delivery packaging in North America with paper filler, working toward full removal by the end of the year.

s: October 18, 2024 - Amazon also said in its blog post ... Amazon-branded sleeves, bags, boxes, and padding. As of December of last year, Amazon was shipping one-third of its sales in North America without any additional packaging, and it said it would increase this fraction to two-thirds by December 2024. s: December 19, 2024 - Big brands are some of the largest contributors to global waste, especially in the consumer goods, technology, and fashion sectors. Companies like Adidas, Amazon, Apple, H&M, Shein, and Unilever ship billions of products each year—most of them packaged in plastic.
